wms_article.title: POSCO’s Q2 OP down 18.7% due to weak secondary battery materials business

wms_article_body.body: South Korean steel giant POSCO posted weaker-than-expected second-quarter results, as gains in its core steel division were offset by sluggish performance in secondary battery materials and construction. POSCO Holdings Inc. reported an operating profit of 610 billion won ($437 million) for the April–June period, down 18.7 percent year-on-year. Sales fell 5.1 percent to 17.6 trillion won, while net profit plunged 85.5 percent to 80 billion won. The steel division delivered an operating profit of 302 billion won, supported by cost-cutting efforts and a digital transformation push, despite weak market conditions. However, POSCO Future M Co., which handles the group’s battery materials business, saw sales decline 28 percent year-on-year, while operating profit dropped 67 percent, largely due to reduced demand for high-nickel cathode materials.
